item.title: Kizuna Encounter: Super Tag Battle ‘NEO GEO Premium Selection’ edition with rollback netcode now available for PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC

2D post-apocalyptic fighting game returns.

SNK has released a new version of 1996-released fighting game Kizuna Encounter: Super Tag Battle for PC via Steam for $19.99 / 2,980 yen as the secodn title in its “NEO GEO Premium Selection“—a selection of NEO GEO titles upgraded with new features for the modern day. It includes rollback netcode with nine-player lobbies, Tournament and Spectator modes, an improved practice mode, and more.

Here is an overview of the game, via SNK:

About

A 2D post-apocalyptic fighting game from SNK that first hit arcades in 1996. Characters from SAVAGE REIGN return, this time teaming up for frantic yet strategic two-on-two tag team battles! This updated release boasts rollback netcode for seamless online action, as well as myriad competitive enhancements that heighten the online experience—including lobbies for up to nine players, a spectator mode, and single / double elimination tournaments. You can tag with friends and compete in frenzied four-player matches as well.

Characters

10 renegades, two ruthless bosses—one apocalyptic fight for the future!

Eight returnees from the previous installment (Savage Reign) square up with two brand-new fighters: resistance leader Rosa and cane-fighting crusader Kim. You can even take boss characters King Leo and Jyazu into battle (solo member fights only).

Online Battles

Thrilling online matches! multiplayer mayhem with four players at once!

Engage in seamless dystopian duels powered by rollback netcode. Multiple tournament formats let you mix it up in lobbies for up to nine players. You can even team up and throw down with fellow challengers in simultaneous four-player battles—a feature limited to select arcade cabinets at the time of original release. Tag with the best brawlers and take the fight worldwide!

New Features

Modern-day overhaul for an arcade classic!

  • Practice Mode – Hit the new and improved Practice Mode, where you can tailor lab sessions to your needs—complete with speed selectors, a hitbox viewer, and more. Master brutal combos as you prepare for each formidable matchup!
  • Jukebox – An integrated jukebox (featuring the game’s soundtrack) and a diverse collection of achievement challenges round out the suite of single-player content. The result—an expanded Kizuna Encounter experience for contemporary gamers!

NEOGEO Premium Selection

A collection of NEOGEO arcade classics, upgraded with new features for the modern day. Crafted and curated with the direct backing of SNK, this premium revival serves as an ode to all our fans across the years and around the world.

Watch the launch trailer below. View a set of screenshots at the gallery.

Launch Trailer

Japanese

item.title: Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves DLC character Joe Higashi now available
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

The Muay Thai champion joins the fray.

Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves downloadable content character Joe Higashi is now available, developer SNK announced. He can be purchased individually or as part of Season Pass 1.

Get the latest details below.

Fresh, Fearless Offense and an All-new Legend Await!

Muay Thai champion Joe Higashi debuted alongside fellow heroes Terry and Andy Bogard in the series’ first entry, Fatal Fury (1991), solidifying their status as faces of the franchise for generations. Now, 26 years after his last roster appearance (1999’s Fatal Fury: Wild Ambition), Joe makes his triumphant return as a playable character! Buckle up as the Summoner of Storms sweeps through South Town once more in Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves!

Joe Higashi (voiced by Kevin Andrew Rivera in English, Kouzou Mito in Japanese)

Famed Muay Thai fighter with stiff kicks that can shatter steel. No other kickboxer can lay a finger, elbow, or knee on Joe Higashi, so the champ winds up tackling a different beast: the silver screen! His biopic documentary, The Legend of Joe (directed by none other than Cheng Sinzan), is already shooting around South Town; Joe even envisions a bit part for star pupil Preecha, whose recent tournament triumphs have done her master proud.

New Stories in Arcade Mode and Episodes of South Town

  • Arcade Mode – Joe and legacy character Cheng Sinzan set out to film a major motion picture, The Legend of Joe, based on the Muay Thai master’s eventful life.
  • Episodes of South Town – Joe’s single-player RPG adventure sees him romp through the city while reminiscing about how he met star pupil Preecha.

Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store.

Watch the trailer below. View the screenshots at the gallery.

DLC Character Joe Higashi Launch Trailer

Japanese

item.title: Borderlands 4 ‘Bounty Pack 1: How Rush Saved Mercenary Day’ launches November 20
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Minister Screw is on the naughty list.

Borderlands 4 downloadable content “Bounty Pack 1: How Rush Saved Mercenary Day” will launch on November 20, publisher 2K and developer Gearbox Software.

The description reads, “Minister Screw is on the naughty list. Deliver his season’s beatings in Bounty Pack 1: How Rush Saved Mercenary Day… As a quick refresher, Bounty Packs are paid downloadable content that bring new bite-sized-yet-flavorful narrative content to Kairos, along with new gear to earn and cosmetics to collect—plus a Vault Card that lets you unlock additional loot through gameplay.”

Borderlands 4 is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store. A Switch 2 version is also in development.

Watch a teaser trailer below.

DLC “Bounty Pack 1: How Rush Saved Mercenary Day” Teaser Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/10/borderlands-4-bounty-pack-1-how-rush-saved-mercenary-day-launches-november-20

item.title: Dragon Ball FighterZ DLC character Goku (Super Saiyan 4, DAIMA) announced; balance update launches October 12
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

A new warrior joins the fight (after four years!)

Bandai Namco has announced Dragon Ball FighterZ downloadable content character Goku (Super Saiyan 4, DAIMA), who will launch in spring 2026. He is the first new fighter to be added to the game in four years.

Additionally, a new balance adjustment update will launch on October 12, “bringing strategic depth to Z-Reflect” and updates to “every character.” Full patch notes will be available when the update launches.

Finally, Bandai Namco announced the Dragon Ball FighterZ Master Showdown at Dragon Ball Games Battle Hour 2026 from April 18 to 19, where participants can fight their way through qualifiers to challenge professional players including GO1, Hikari, SonicFox, Wawa, Wade, and Yasha.

Dragon Ball FighterZ is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam.

Watch a new trailer below.

EVO France 2025 Trailer

English

Japanese
